utterances: I was even thinking about getting one! I know that Tiki is still only a puppy but I've already got all of the puppy supplies. Or maybe I should be more rational and just give those to you!
I think I might hold off on getting a puppy until Tony crosses the Rainbow Bridge. He is really starting to show his age, and I don't think he'd like a puppy.
That might be a good idea, but some older dogs really like the company of a puppy.
I should visit a rescue with some younger dogs and bring Tony to see how well his plays with them. Do you think Tiki needs a friend to help get his energy out?

We went to the farm to visit Herald and he is doing well.
How old is Herald again?
[[blender3-3B:17]]
I had a barbecue with my spouse today.
Oh nice! How did that go for you?
We threw some ribs on the grills, as well as steaks and sausages. We made so much that we gave away food to our neighbors.
I tend to do the same when I cook out! Or I just feed my cats, haha. Oh, I think I told you about my yacht trip. I'm already planning another one for next year!
That's great. I jus ot back from Norway. Beautiful country with lovely people. It must be tough getting a sitter for 23 cats, I'd imagine..
Luckily my brother is as much of a cat lover as I am! I'll have to visit Norway some time. It sounds great.
It was. I intend to return. what countries did you visit during your yacht trip?
[[blender3-3B:21]]
I listened to rap music and ate hamburgers while we spoke.
Oh wow! I don't know anything much about music, of course... I know that there are different forms of rap, though. Is yours angry rap, dirty rap, political rap, or what?
It's basically any kind of rap there is, I love it all! Was going to ask you, have you read any good books lately?

I'm actually re-reading an old favorite just now. A Russian novel by Doystoyevsky. I'm reading a different translation this time - it's surprising how different the different translations can be. It makes you realize how much the translator has to do! Are you reading lately?

Oh that sounds interesting! Yes, I've been reading a book about numbers. That's kind of what I do now that I'm retired. In the book it explains what favorite numbers mean, I found out that my favorite number, 62, actually means that I am a calm person and I like to relax, which is true. I read about your favorite number too, number 7 means friendly and sure of themself which is definately you!
Do I come across as sure of myself? I'm glad to hear that - I often don't feel that way. Is the book you're reading something like numerology? I don't really know what that is... Is it like astology?

It's not really like astrology, but it is close I guess because numbers in a way are aligned like the stars! I find all of that interesting. Too bad you don't know how to drive, you could come over and I could show you the book.

Oh, that would be fun. I can always take an Uber, but I'm not sure we're that close to each other. Maybe you can come over here some time. Now that you're retired, do you find yourself bored, or is it easy to fill your time?
[[blender3-3B:30]]
I have been doing a lot of hiking this week. The weather has been great here.
That's great. Where do you live where the weather's nice? It has been a pretty cold winter here.
I live in Florida, I don't like the weather been so cold, I bet you are used to the canadian weather
Yeah haha. How many days a week do you hike?

No, I had a ham and cheese sandwich and went to bed. Did you brush your teeth last night?
I did indeed. I had to get up and get ready for my trip today.
Oh really, where are you going? I know that you like to travel.
[[blender3-3B:47]]
Do you have any recommendations for environmentally-friendly volunteer opportunities?

I'll tell you one thing I've done with my son that was fun. If you live in a place where soda and beer cans and bottles have refunds, you can collect them off the road and elsewhere, return them for the refund, and then donate the money, or a portion of it, to an environmental charity.
Oh wow, that is such a great idea! There is usually tons of litter downtown. Maybe we can make it a family activity. What got you and your son started with that?

Someone raising money for a sports team knocked on my door and asked if I had any empty soda or beer cans he could have to raise money for their team. I thought it was a neat idea, and started noticing all the empties on the side of the road and on benches and everywhere else, and thought that it could be a fun way to raise some money, or for my son to raise money and be active. Sort of a treasure hunt, and one that cleans up town in the process.
Wow that was a resourceful kid who introduced you to the idea. I love activities that have multiple purposes! It's like being able to multitask without diverting attention too much.

Absolutely. And if you were to do it with your son, I think they'd naturally start to see that physical things can have uses even when they've already been used. There's nothing more disgusting than a half-empty beer can that's been sitting in a ditch for a year, but when your son sees that that's worth money and can be reused, it might encourage their perspective on reusing and recycling things in general.
I love your mindset about this. If we had more parents thinking like you, we'd have at least one part of the environmental crisis solved.
Thank you! I'm not sure I deserve that much credit but I do think it's a fun, productive activity. Anything exciting happening with your bookkeeping in the last day or so?

Whether it was your idea or not, you certainly deserve some credit for taking action on it. That's the part that counts! And as far as bookkeeping goes, I'm keeping the company financially afloat one ledger at a time, haha.

Haha! I'm sure they don't pay you nearly enough then! Well, sometimes our jobs are our passion, and sometimes they're what allow us to pursue our passions. I enjoy programming itself, but don't enjoy my job as much, particularly when I'm under time pressure. So I find whatever joy I can outside of work.

Yeah, jobs have this weird way of sucking the joy out of things, even if you love the work. Honestly, I think it's an issue of leadership and environment. Fix those two things and I guarantee most people would enjoy their jobs more.
I think that's largely true. If you were just doing bookkeeping for yourself, would you enjoy the actual process of doing it?
[[blender3-3B:59]]
What do you like the most about the east coast?
I love all the beaches. Do you have a lot of beaches by you?
Yes! The Oregon coast is beautiful! It's usually pretty chilly to be going for a swim though!
That sucks that is a to cold for a swim. It is always hot here. That why I am at the beach a lot.
That sounds nice! It's usually cool enough that I can enjoy a nice run so that's good. Do you swim or surf at the beach?
That is good that you are able to do a run. I do some of both I love surfing and also swimming. Do you usually run in the morning, mid day or afternoons/night time?
[[blender3-3B:60]]
I finally finished that violin part to banjo
Awesome! How does it sound?!
Surprisingly awesome. I was really surprised at how nice the sound came out of it.
I can't wait to hear it! Are you able to send me a copy of the track?
Give me a couple days and I'll get one made for you. Still trying to get the last little bit down on it.
Great! I look forward to listening to it. Did your husband help with it?
He tried, but he just got in my way. He does love when I play and he can't wait to hear what I can do with it.
Haha. I am glad he is still supportive! I haven't been able to play much lately because of all the scorpion stings
Oh, yeah makes my legs hurt just thinking about. How are you doing? How did you major to get stung by so many scorpions in the first place
[[blender3-3B:74]]
I felt like a poor mans' House, M.D. with all the weirdo medical mysteries at work today. At least I never stop learning in this job.
Then you can relax for some time right? because if you work continuously like this with these mysteries you would feel tired.
[[blender3-3B:89]]
How has teaching in school been? Have you seen any new Netflix shows lately?
Teaching has been good! My students are very eager to learn. I have been watching a true crime documentary on Netflix. Are you watching anything on Netflix?
Glad to hear that! Yes, I'm watching The Haunting of Bly Manor now, it's pretty scary, but super interesting. What is the true crime documentary you're watching about?
[[blender3-3B:93]]
I started making some new vegan recipes I think you might like.
Oh really? what are they?
[[blender3-3B:103]]
I spoke to my boss about having live music.
Oh yeah? What did he think of it?
[[blender3-3B:104]]
I went by my shop and found all of my paperwork from when I started my shop. I thought you might like to look at it.
Yes, thanks. That would be helpful. I have a lot to learn. How is the shop doing?
It's going great, lots of new customers and cars will always have issues so it keeps me needed lol.
That is true. That seems like a stable business. You have done well. I really have to figure things out. Things have been rough since my wife was laid off.
I hated to hear that. My best advice is just take your time and do it right. Are you starting a business related to game design?
[[blender3-3B:108]]
I am thinking about moving out of my parents' house.
Really? When? Do you have an apartment lined up?

Sort of... it's more like a basement situation. But I think I can make it look cute. It's just across the street, so I can still eat at my folks' house and stuff. How's your plan to get a car coming along?

I'm about $1k short to get that used Honda that's for sale down the street. With warm weather coming, I'm hoping to do yard for neighbors to make up the extra cash. How do your parents feel about you moving across the street?

They haven't really noticed so far. They'd probably be glad to see less of me, to be honest. My mom keeps mentioning that her choir has some new lady with a son who plays piano, and will happily take over my job if I take off. Gee, thanks, Mom...

Maybe she wants you to finally try out for your local orchestra. I'm mean you are a professional, you should be player in bigger venues than at your mom's church. And if you audition, you'll get to travel. So it's kind of like a road trip.... Any thoughts on where we want to go for our trip before I head back to school? I was thinking of just heading down the coast.

I was more enthusiastic about the road trip when you were talking about getting a Ferrari, to tell you the truth - ha ha. No, just kidding. Yes to the coast, for sure! North or South? Can't really play piano in an orchestra. I was thinking of trying out for the local theater company, though. I'd get to see all the plays for free, at least.

There are some orchestras/symphonys that need pianist. You should check it out. You could also go into business for yourself and teach others how to play. Check with me in 50 years for that Ferrari! I'm thinking South. It will be warmer down there and plenty of sunshine and beaches. Have you talked your neighbor into taking you for a ride in his car yet?

Yeah... that dude has sort of a bad attitude now. He caught me coming out of his basement a couple times, and sort of yelled at me. It might be better for me just to try out the Lambo some time when he's at work. Hey - why don't we take that for the road trip? That could be really fun, don't you think?

If your idea of fun is going to jail! No, I think I'll wait till I can afford to buy my own car instead of a joy ride. Besides I'm sure college doesn't want to see that on my record. So what did you think of the idea about teach piano lessons?

It's a thought, yeah. I tried to teach the neighbor's cat some stuff. Just the basics, like scales, and a few major and minor chords. I don't think he practices much on his own, though. I see very little progress. So I don't know - that makes me doubt my teaching ability. Are you a musician yourself?
The neighbor's cat? I hope you meant their kid? Don't blame yourself, the kid needs to practice. Try a few more lessons and you'll see improvement.
[[blender3-3B:130]]
Do you think you could use a hand taking care of your animals? I would be willing to help out for a small fee.
I'm not interested in hiring anyone to help out, but you're welcome to visit and meet my animal friends!

Sounds good, I would love to do that. I am pretty busy as it is on the farm, but I am trying to look out for extra sources of income. Do you do anything for extra income on the side? Any recommendations?
I do sell some of the eggs my chickens lay at the farmer's market. That's something that would seem to be right up your alley.

Yes, I already sell a lot of produce and eggs at the farmers market. I was thinking of maybe converting one of my smaller barns into an Airbnb for people to stay in, as part of farm-tourism. Maybe that would be of interest for people visiting the area!
That's a fabulous idea! Are you pretty skilled with carpentry and such? If you can do the conversion economically, it could be a real boon.
My brother is actually a carpenter. We had a bit of a falling out a few months ago, but maybe this could really rekindle our relationship. Do you have any siblings?
I'm sorry to hear that, but maybe this project could be an opportunity to bond. I have two younger brothers and an older sister. We rarely see each other as they're on the east coast.

It isn't anything too serious, but we just took some time to do our own things. We disagree a lot on politics and other issues, but ultimately I think we are just two different types of people. He is super social, loves city living etc. But maybe this can be a way for us to bring back that sibling bond.
I see. I can definitely relate to that, as my siblings are pretty social while I'm not. Do you enjoy driving a truck? It sounds perfect for an anti-social personality!
Absolutely, my dog Brewery puts his head out of the window and we cruise down the country listening to classic rock music. It's heaven!
That sounds amazing! What a lovely name for a dog. Which breed is Brewery?
[[blender3-3B:138]]
I've been thinking about buying a tv.
Which brand do you think you will get?
I'm not sure, I'm a bit clueless to everything I need. Have you got any recommendations? I fancy something that will last me some time
I have a Samsung TV and I love it. It's a reliable, modern brand with some really cool tech. Do you have Netflix or Hulu? If so I would get a smart TV so you can stream them via wifi
[[blender3-3B:141]]
My parrot learned the words to my favorite song. Now it sings Another One Bites the Dust all day long!
That must really annoy you. Did you make anything delicious at work today?
I made some delicious parmesan encrusted tilapia. The patrons loves it. Do you and your spouse go out to eat often?
I'm not home very often, out on the road a lot. But I frequent a lot of different restaurants on my routes, cross country. What's your favorite dish to make?
My favorite dish to make is chicken fried chicken. Do you stop and sit down and eat or do you get it to go so you can make better times?
I try an go out for at least one meal a day, so my legs can stretch. Do you cook for your mom or just when you're at work?
I bring home food from the restaurant for her. She loves to try it.
What does Parrot eat? And is he singing a different song now?

I rode one of my horses for the first time! He seemed a bit hesitant to let me ride him, but eventually he warmed up to it and walked around my property without misbehaving. It was a nice bonding experience for us.
It sounds fun, I am sort of scared of horses.
They're really sweet when you get to know them. Do you ever watch the Kentucky Derby horse race? It is held once a year and it is today!
I'll watch it when I come across it on TV. But I did not realized it was on today. I'll try to watch it if I feel well enough.
I'm so sorry you're under the weather. Do you know what's making you sick?
It is not that I am sick, it is my family life getting me down
You must be feeling stressed about the divorce. Do you wanna talk about it?
nothing much I could say, we just decide it was best to get a divorce.

I got divorced in my late 20s -- it was hard, but it led to me finding my wife whom I'm married to now! I know it probably feels like there's no end in sight, but you'll come out on the other side of it. Tell me something you feel hopeful or positive about? Might help you feel better
The only thing positive is my job as a car salesman. I like meeting different people and making them happy with a new car.
nothing like a good vehicle! I use my truck for everything. it feels like a family member! what type of cars do you sell?
[[blender3-3B:152]]
What would you like to do instead of being a waiter.

Have you considered getting a standing desk or treadmill desk?
I've thought about that, but my old knee injury makes it harder to walk for long periods of time on a treadmill.
Oh, how did you injure your knee?

My pug did the funniest thing last night while we were watching basketball.
Oh no, what did your pug do? Did he fart?
[[blender3-3B:161]]
I have an interview lined up for the surf instructor job I told you about.
Awesome! Are you excited for it? The job seem like a good fit?
[[blender3-3B:165]]
How is your job going? Can you tell me more about the medical field?
I'm not exactly on the front lines so I can't say I know the ins and outs of your role in the field, but overall the pace is fast, and helping out is always rewarding!
That sounds nice. I'm just so over school, I can't wait to feel like I'm doing something that matters. So, what do you do, exactly? Are there any part-time jobs for high school students in your area?

It feels a lot nicer than school, but school is such an important first step. I'm in charge of filing, you'd be surprised how many documents we house and for how many people! We do internships at my location, actually!
Filing, as in, paper documents? Wow! I can't believe hospitals are still using paper! An internship sounds amazing. How many hours a week?

[[blender3-3B:175]]
What is your favorite place to visit in Europe?
My favorite place is probably Germany. Whats your favorite part about Italy's history?

I love the arts and architecture so obviously would love to go to the museums there to learn more about it. And Italian food is amazing. I'm trying to cook more at home and I recently just bought an Italian cookbook.
I'm also trying to cook more at home! Do you have any favorite recipes from that cookbook yet? Maybe when you visit Florida you could show me.

I made a lasagna yesterday and it was awesome. I put in a lot of veggies in it. I've been trying to lower my meat consumption and eat healthy! You know I would love to visit Florida. I heard it's sunny there all the time, even during the winter? It's so cold and rainy where I live.

That's definitely a good goal, I've also been trying to eat less meat. I want to be more healthy, but I also learned about how bad it is for the environment to be eating red meat. I am really concerned about climate change and would like to do my part! Speaking of weather, Florida is pretty sunny all the time, but I think I would prefer having all 4 seasons!

That's awesome! Removing red meat from your diet is a great start, even if you still eat other meat. It really is so bad for the environment. Plus, there's a lot of great plant based meat alternatives out there now. Have you ever seen snow in Florida?! I do love snow so I think I would also prefer having all 4 seasons.
[[blender3-3B:177]]

I was talking to a friend three days ago, and they mentioned they are giving away kittens that their cat just gave birth to. You should give them a call, and ask to adopt one. I am sure they would be happy to give you a kitten, given how well you take care of your cat.
Oh my goodness that's so exciting! Yes I'll definitely give them a call, at least just to talk about it and see whether one of the kittens would be right for me. Would you consider getting one too?
I'm not sure honestly. As you know, I'd rather have a cockatoo. Don't you think kittens are more work?

Yes they are, they are very cute but especially when they are young they need quite a lot of attention. Once they are older they are a little more independent. I remember you saying your sister has a dog; what breed is it?
I guess that's true. She has a corgi! He is pretty adorable. Maybe for now it's enough for me to just play with him. I've heard pets can be pretty expensive too, right?

Oh corgis are so cute! What's his name? Yea it's nice when a friend or family member has a pet as you don't have to make the commitment yourself, but you still get to enjoy having an animal around sometimes. And yes, vet bills can be very expensive!
Exactly! I feel the same way about children. They're cute and fun to play with but I'd rather not have all that responsibility. Do you like kids?

Kids can be awesome, but personally I don't think I'd want to have any of my own. But I have a sister who is keen to have kids one day, so maybe I'll be a cool uncle at some point. What about you, do you think you'll have kids in the future?
Maybe in the distant future. Right now I don't have enough money saved anyways. I have to focus on saving up I guess. So how's your girlfriend's cockatoo?
[[blender3-3B:178]]
My wireless headphones arrived and they are fantastic!
Awesome! Which brand did you get?
[[blender3-3B:185]]
I accidentally spilled my 6 egg omelet on the crime novel I was halfway through reading.
OMG LOL...sorry if I am laughing but I am imagining your face. How did you do it?

It is kind of funny now, but it was not funny an hour ago. I am still cleaning egg up. I was walking, holding the book in one hand and the plate of food in the other. I dropped the book on the floor, and then dropped the omlette alll over it.
I know I know, but knowing you I imagine how you got angry and you wanted to destroy everything. I hope no one was around otherwise you would have sent someone to the hospital
It was not a good start to the day. Are you feeling any less stressed out than you were earlier?
Not really... This morning I woke up anxious and looks like today is the end of the world. Did it ever happen to wake up in this way?

I am sorry you are feeling stressed out and down. I understand, and have felt that way, also. Maybe you could get outside for a little while- go for a walk or play football? Doesn't football often elevate your mood?

I prefer to be alone today, not feeling to be play football with someone else. I am planning to go out for a walk and enjoy some fresh air and this beautiful sun. I hope it will help me. Sorry if I am coming back on the argument, but have you been able to save your book at least?
[[blender3-3B:217]]
I looked up alton brown's meatloaf recipe.
Have you tried it yet? I am looking for new recipes.
I haven't had the opportunity to try it yet. I was thinking about making it tonight to celebrate my dog ToTo's fifth birthday!
Oh nice, I am sure he will love it. Let me know how it turns out. What kind of dog is he?
I really hope so. He loves all types of meats so it should be good. He's a golden retriver. My grandma always tells me how she had a dog that looked just like him when she was growing up in Denmark!
Aww that adorable. Golden's are great companion dogs. Sirius is a pug. He loves the cured meats me and my dad make.

That sounds so cute. I love the way small dogs run around. I bet he's always trying to get meat from you! ToTo recently learned how to open the refrigerator so now he's looking inside it for his meals.
Haha he is! That is a good trick, now you just need to teach him to fetch you snacks
I wish! That would be so much fun. But he seems to always want me to bring him food. I don't think he'd ever bring anything to me. Is Sirius good at sharing?
[[blender3-3B:221]]
I decided to grow a beard too.
Really? I love my beard. How are you liking it so far?
[[blender3-3B:224]]
I just saw the nicest antique bathtub.
Oh wow, lucky!! is it a claw foot tub?
[[blender3-3B:228]]
I'm currently painting a new background for my next performance.
Ohh--that's awesome. What is the show's theme?
Freedom within is the theme for the show.
What kind of backdrop are you painting?
[[blender3-3B:239]]
I read an interesting article about New Zealand. They are opening a travel bubble with Australia. Their COVID-19 cases seem to be under control.
Yes, I'm very excited to hear Jacinda Arden's announcement. I will wait until I get vaccinated before I jet off to be extra safe. When are you planning to go to New Zealand?
I'm not sure yet, I don't have a lot of free time nowadays. Maybe in the next year, who knows. What about you, did you pick a date?

Yes, I will be in New Zealand from 14-28 July. It will be winter there, and I am most excited to go hiking at Fox glacier in the South Island. How do you urinate on the plane when you are in a wheelchair?

Oh, that's awesome, I've seen a few photos of Fox Glacier too, it looks amazing. I wish I could've went there this summer, but I probably won't. Did you pick a hotel to stay in already? I need some help with that.

I haven't booked accommodation as it's too far out. Hotel rates tend to drop closer-in, so I plan to only start booking hotels in June. I will let you know whether the properties I stay at are accessible, so you can get a good idea. Will your kids be going with you?
Right, makes sense. Thank you! I wish they did, not sure they're interested though. I'm yet to ask them if they want to go, will do that closer to the trip.
Fingers crossed the travel bubble plans don't get rescinded; otherwise, I will have to postpone my trip until I don't know when. Will you be visiting the North Island, South Island or both?
[[blender3-3B:242]]
I went hiking at a new location.
Where about's? Was it a long hike?
[[blender3-3B:247]]
I finished fixing up that old car, it has a fresh coat of paint and the brakes are working.
That's good to hear, I would love to be able to fix up cars and make them look brand new. Do you keep the cars you fix or do you sell them to others?
I usually dont I either use them until I find a new project sometimes I thought of putting them up for sale them
I would imagine many people would love to buy a restored car from you. After all, if there is a market for people looking to restore planes theres bound to be a bigger one for cars.

You are absolutly right I should look into it and Its not too difficult to learn to customise you car you could do it to just start small look up some videos on you tube you seem very smart what are you studying in collage?
I'm currently studying Physics, hoping to get a Bachelor's Degree for it. I'm not sure if I want to continue my education afterwards or pursue a career with it.
Wow Physics that sounds really hard you must do alot of studying I wish I could go back to collage if I did maybe I could pursue a career in rebuilding cars
Physics can be hard for me at times, but I really enjoy doing it. You mentioned that you listen to vinyls, have you gotten any bought any recently?
no not recently I useually have to spend alot of money to get good ones they are like antiques these days few and far but I have plenty of favorites in my collection already

That's interesting to hear, I always found vinyls interesting and found it neat that people still collect and listen to them. My father can't get enough of them, and always enjoys finding a new one for his collection.
Yes the sound is just different its like no other, Your father must be pretty cool do you ever listen with him when your not to busy with collage work?
[[blender3-3B:252]]
I finished writing my will!
That is great, did your dad help you write it, since he used to be a lawyer?
Yes, he did, although I did most of it myself based on what I found online. I discovered that it really isn't as difficult as it looks. Have you started yours yet?
Yes i started but i am not done yet, maybe you can help me since you are done with yours?
Sure! And maybe your granddaughter could help, too. She might want a break from childcare on occasion to use her brain again!
She would help me for sure, but she is not exactly an expert, she would be much better at helping you with your parrot haha

True! Though I suppose she has a better idea of your assets and personal preferences. Like, have you already thought about your keepsakes and family heirlooms? That's easy for me for now. I am just leaving everything to my parents at the moment, but will revise later.
That part will be simple for me aswell since i plan on leaving all of that to my granddaughter, how about your parrot, is it in your will aswell?

I am making great progress on my philosophy project!
What exactly is your philosophy project about?

I just played "We Will Rock You" on the drums

It is my favorite song to play. However the only song I know how to play. I am practicing everyday to learn more songs. By the way, are you done baking that cake you said you were going to do today?
That's awesome! I wish I knew how to play an instrument. And yes I did finish baking the cake, it is cooling off now in the baking tray before I put icing on it.
Do you mind if I go over to have some cake. I like cake a lot.

Sure! There will definitely be enough for the both of us. But let me bring it over to you instead - that way I can listen to you play your song on the drums! What flavor icing would you like on the cake?

That sound like a better plan because my only method of transportation is a bike. So i am goin to go ahead and have my drums ready.
